Operation 'get-company-configuration' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context. Original summary and description are too generic. Added specificity about expense sync context, clarified what configuration controls, and mentioned the return schema for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Gets a companies expense sync configuration
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the expense sync configuration for a specified company. This includes settings that control how expenses are mapped and synced to the company's accounting software. Returns the CompanyConfiguration object containing the current sync settings.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are too generic. Added specificity about expense sync context, clarified what configuration controls, and mentioned the return schema for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'save-company-configuration' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks detail about inputs, outputs, and side effects. Enhanced to clarify that it accepts CompanyConfiguration, returns the updated config, and importantly notes that changes affect subsequent syncs. This helps AI agents understand the operation's impact.

data.current_description: Sets a companies expense sync configuration
data.description_suggestion: Updates the expense sync configuration for a specified company. Accepts a CompanyConfiguration object containing the desired sync settings for mapping and syncing expenses to the company's accounting software. Returns the updated configuration. This operation modifies the company's sync behavior for all subsequent expense syncs.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks detail about inputs, outputs, and side effects. Enhanced to clarify that it accepts CompanyConfiguration, returns the updated config, and importantly notes that changes affect subsequent syncs. This helps AI agents understand the operation's impact.

message: Operation 'create-partner-expense-connection' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to explain what a Partner Expense connection is, why it's needed, what it enables, and what is returned. Added context about it being a prerequisite for syncs to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Creates a Partner Expense data connection
data.description_suggestion: Establishes a new Partner Expense data connection for a company. This connection enables the company to sync expense data from their Partner Expense platform to their accounting software. The operation creates the connection link and returns connection details including the connection ID and status. This is a prerequisite for initiating expense syncs.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to explain what a Partner Expense connection is, why it's needed, what it enables, and what is returned. Added context about it being a prerequisite for syncs to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'get-mapping-options' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original summary is too vague (just 'Mapping options'). Description lacks clarity about what mapping options are and their purpose. Enhanced to explain that options are determined by the accounting software, clarify the return value, and provide context for when an AI agent should use this operation.

data.current_description: Gets the expense mapping options for a companies accounting software
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the available mapping options for a company's expenses based on their connected accounting software. Returns a list of valid mapping configurations that define how expense fields (such as accounts, cost centers, and categories) can be mapped during sync. Use this to understand what mapping choices are available before configuring the company's sync settings.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague (just 'Mapping options'). Description lacks clarity about what mapping options are and their purpose. Enhanced to explain that options are determined by the accounting software, clarify the return value, and provide context for when an AI agent should use this operation.

message: Operation 'intiate-sync' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_side_effects. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks context about what is being synced to where, the asynchronous nature, and how to track progress. Enhanced to clarify the destination (accounting software), mention the 202 response code, explain asynchronous processing, and note that only pending transactions are included.

data.summary_suggestion: Trigger expense sync to accounting software
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a synchronization of pending expense transactions to the company's connected accounting software. Accepts a PostSync request object containing sync parameters. Returns a 202 Accepted response with a sync ID for tracking the operation's progress. The sync runs asynchronously; use the sync status endpoints to monitor completion. Only transactions in pending state will be synced.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks context about what is being synced to where, the asynchronous nature, and how to track progress. Enhanced to clarify the destination (accounting software), mention the 202 response code, explain asynchronous processing, and note that only pending transactions are included.

message: Operation 'get-last-successful-sync' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original summary is incomplete (missing verb). Description is vague about what status information is returned. Enhanced to clarify it returns CompanySyncStatus, explain what information is included, and provide context for when to use this operation versus get-latest-sync.

data.current_description: Gets the status of the last successful sync
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the status and details of the most recent successfully completed expense sync for a company. Returns a CompanySyncStatus object containing sync metadata, completion time, transaction count, and any relevant status information. Use this to verify the most recent successful synchronization of expenses to the accounting software.
data.reasoning: Original summary is incomplete (missing verb). Description is vague about what status information is returned. Enhanced to clarify it returns CompanySyncStatus, explain what information is included, and provide context for when to use this operation versus get-latest-sync.

message: Operation 'get-latest-sync' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original summary lacks a verb. Description is too vague and doesn't distinguish this from get-last-successful-sync. Enhanced to clarify it returns CompanySyncStatus, explain it includes all recent syncs (not just successful ones), and provide guidance on when to use this versus the last successful sync endpoint.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the status and details of the most recent expense sync for a company, regardless of completion state. Returns a CompanySyncStatus object containing sync metadata, current progress, transaction count, and status information. Use this to monitor ongoing or recently completed syncs. For only successful syncs, use the last successful sync endpoint instead.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks a verb. Description is too vague and doesn't distinguish this from get-last-successful-sync. Enhanced to clarify it returns CompanySyncStatus, explain it includes all recent syncs (not just successful ones), and provide guidance on when to use this versus the last successful sync endpoint.

message: Operation 'list-syncs' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original description is too generic and lacks context about pagination, what data is returned, and the operation's purpose. Added clarity about company scope, return data structure, and use case for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Gets a list of sync statuses
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all expense sync statuses for a company
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all expense sync statuses for the specified company. Each sync status includes the sync ID, timestamp, state (pending, completed, failed), and summary of transactions processed. Use this to monitor the history and current state of expense synchronizations to the accounting platform.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and lacks context about pagination, what data is returned, and the operation's purpose. Added clarity about company scope, return data structure, and use case for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'get-sync-by-id' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original description lacks specificity about what status information is returned and the operation's practical use case. Enhanced with details about return values and when an AI agent should use this operation versus list-syncs.

data.current_description: Get the sync status for a specified sync
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve detailed status for a specific expense sync
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the detailed status of a specific expense sync by sync ID. Returns the sync state (pending, completed, failed), timestamp, transaction count, and any error details if the sync failed. Use this to check the progress and outcome of a particular expense synchronization to the accounting platform.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about what status information is returned and the operation's practical use case. Enhanced with details about return values and when an AI agent should use this operation versus list-syncs.

message: Operation 'list-sync-transactions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original description has grammatical error ('Get's') and lacks detail about pagination, filtering, and what transaction status information is available. Added clarity about transaction-level details and use cases for AI agents to determine when to call this versus get-sync-transaction.

data.current_description: Get's the transactions and status for a sync
data.summary_suggestion: List all transactions and their statuses within a sync
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all expense transactions within a specific sync and their individual processing statuses. Each transaction includes its ID, status (pending, completed, failed), mapped accounting references, and any validation errors. Supports filtering and sorting via query parameters. Use this to review transaction-level details and identify any failed or problematic expense entries within a sync.
data.reasoning: Original description has grammatical error ('Get's') and lacks detail about pagination, filtering, and what transaction status information is available. Added clarity about transaction-level details and use cases for AI agents to determine when to call this versus get-sync-transaction.

message: Operation 'get-sync-transaction' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original description is too vague about what status information is returned. Enhanced with details about transaction metadata, mapping information, and practical use cases for AI agents to understand when to retrieve individual transaction details.

data.current_description: Gets the status of a transaction for a sync
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve detailed status for a specific transaction in a sync
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the detailed status and metadata for a specific expense transaction within a sync. Returns the transaction status (pending, completed, failed), mapped accounting references (account, contact, line items), validation results, and any error messages if processing failed. Use this to investigate individual transaction details, verify correct accounting mappings, or diagnose why a specific expense failed to sync.
data.reasoning: Original description is too vague about what status information is returned. Enhanced with details about transaction metadata, mapping information, and practical use cases for AI agents to understand when to retrieve individual transaction details.

message: Operation 'create-expense-dataset' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks context about what constitutes an expense transaction, what fields are expected, and the relationship to sync operations. Added clarity about the staging nature of created transactions and that they require a subsequent sync operation to reach the accounting platform.

data.summary_suggestion: Create a new expense transaction dataset
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new expense transaction dataset for the specified company. Accepts expense transaction details including amount, date, merchant, category, and optional receipt attachment references. Returns the created transaction with an assigned transaction ID. The transaction is staged for later synchronization to the accounting platform via a sync operation. Multiple transactions can be created before triggering a sync.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks context about what constitutes an expense transaction, what fields are expected, and the relationship to sync operations. Added clarity about the staging nature of created transactions and that they require a subsequent sync operation to reach the accounting platform.

message: Operation 'update-expense-dataset' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original description is too generic and doesn't explain partial update support or the 202 response code semantics. Added clarity about what can be updated, partial update behavior, and the asynchronous nature of the operation.

data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing expense transaction with new or modified details such as amount, date, merchant, category, or mappings. Accepts partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated transaction. Changes are staged and will be reflected in the next sync to the accounting platform. Returns HTTP 202 Accepted indicating the update is queued for processing.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and doesn't explain partial update support or the 202 response code semantics. Added clarity about what can be updated, partial update behavior, and the asynchronous nature of the operation.

message: Operation 'upload-attachment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original description is misleading - it suggests the attachment is created directly in accounting software, but it's actually staged for sync. Clarified that attachments are uploaded to the platform and synced to accounting software. Added context about supported formats and the attachment's role in the sync process.

data.current_description: Creates an attachment in the accounting software against the given transactionId
data.summary_suggestion: Upload receipt attachment for an expense transaction
data.description_suggestion: Uploads a receipt or supporting document attachment for a specific expense transaction within a sync. The attachment is associated with the transaction in the accounting software during synchronization. Supports common image and document formats (PDF, JPG, PNG). Returns the attachment reference ID. Attachments are included when the transaction is synced to the accounting platform.
data.reasoning: Original description is misleading - it suggests the attachment is created directly in accounting software, but it's actually staged for sync. Clarified that attachments are uploaded to the platform and synced to accounting software. Added context about supported formats and the attachment's role in the sync process.
